intro: Cassipourea killipii, commonly known as the Killip's cassipourea, is a flowering plant species native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and elliptical, glossy leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
